member.name: P:Splunk.ApplicationArgs.Description
member.summary: Sets the description of the application.

member.name: P:Splunk.ApplicationArgs.Label
member.summary: Sets the label of the application that is displayed in the Splunk GUI and Launcher.
member.remarks: The recommended length of the application label is between 5 and 80 characters, and it must not include "Splunk For".

member.name: P:Splunk.ApplicationArgs.Template
member.summary: Sets the template type used when creating the application.
member.remarks:
This property's valid values are:
"barebones" indicates the template contains the basic framework for an app.
"sample_app" indicates the template contains example views and searches.
or the name of a previously installed template

member.name: T:Splunk.Event
member.summary: The class wraps an individual event or result that was returned by the class. An event maps each field name to an instance of class, which is a list of zero of more values.

member.name: P:Splunk.Event.SegmentedRaw
member.summary:
Gets the XML markup for the "_raw" field value. This value is only used by the class.
The return value is different than that of the "_raw" field value in that this segmented raw value is an XML fragment that includes all markup such as XML tags and escaped characters. For example, anEvent["_raw"] field value returns this:
"http://localhost:8000/en-US/app/search/flashtimeline?q=search%20search%20index%3D_internal%20%7C%20head%2010&earliest=rt-1h&latest=rt"
anEvent.SegmentedRaw returns this:
"http://localhost:8000/en-US/app/search/flashtimeline?q=search%20search%20index%3D_internal%20%7C%20head%2010&earliest=rt-1h&latest=rt"

member.name: T:Splunk.Event.FieldValue
member.summary: A field can be accessed as either an or as a delimited string (using an implicit string converter or ). Splunk recommends accessing values as an array when possible.

remarks.para: The delimiter for field values depends on the underlying result format. If the underlying format does not specify a delimiter, such as with the class, the delimiter is , which is a comma (,).

member.summary: Gets or sets the block sign size for this index.

If this property is set to "0", block signing is disabled for this index.
This property's recommended value is "100".
This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.BloomfilterTotalSizeKB

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.BucketRebuildMemoryHint
member.summary: Gets or sets the suggestion Splunk bucket rebuild process for the size of the time-series (tsidx) file to make.

remarks.para: Caution: This is an advanced parameter. Inappropriate use of this parameter causes splunkd to not start if rebuild is required. Do not set this parameter unless instructed by Splunk Support.
This property's default value is "auto".
This property is available starting in Splunk 5.0.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ColdPath
member.summary: Gets an absolute filesystem path, local to the server, to the cold database for the index. The path must be both readable and writable.

remarks.para: Cold databases are opened as needed when searching. May be defined in terms of a volume definition (see volume).
This property's value may contain shell expansion terms.
Be aware that Splunk will not start if an index lacks a valid .

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ColdPathExpanded
member.summary: Gets the expanded absolute file path to the cold database for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ColdToFrozenDir
member.summary: Gets the destination filesystem path, local to the server, for the frozen archive. Splunk automatically puts frozen buckets in this directory.

remarks.para: Use as an alternative to a .
Bucket freezing policy is as follows:

list.item: New style buckets (4.2 and on): removes all files but the rawdata. To thaw, run splunk rebuild "bucket dir" on the bucket, then move to the thawed directory.
Old style buckets (Pre-4.2): gzip all the .data and .tsidx files. To thaw, gunzip the zipped files and move the bucket into the thawed directory for that index.

remarks.para: Note: If both the and properties are specified, the property takes precedence.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ColdToFrozenScript
member.summary: Gets the filesystem path, local to the server, that is the archiving script.

remarks.para: Bucket freezing policy is as follows:

list.item: New style buckets (4.2 and on): removes all files but the rawdata. To thaw, run splunk rebuild "bucket dir" on the bucket, then move to the thawed directory. Use the unless you need to perform a more advanced operation upon freezing buckets.
Old style buckets (Pre-4.2): gzip all the .data and .tsidx files. To thaw, gunzip the zipped files and move the bucket into the thawed directory for that index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.CompressRawdata
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the raw data is compressed.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.CurrentDBSizeMB
member.summary: Gets the current size of this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.DefaultDatabase

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.EnableOnlineBucketRepair
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether asynchronous (online fsck) bucket repair is enabled. When enabled, bucket repair runs concurrently with Splunk.

remarks.para: When this feature is enabled, you don't have to wait for buckets to be repaired before starting Splunk, but you might notice a slight degradation in performance as a result.
This property's default value is "enabled".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.EnableRealtimeSearch
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether real-time search is enabled for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.FrozenTimePeriodInSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds after which indexed data rolls to frozen.

remarks.para: Freezing data means it is removed from the index. If archiving is necessary for frozen data, see the ColdToFrozen attributes, and .
This property's default value is "188697600" (6 years).

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.HomePath
member.summary: Gets an absolute path that contains the hot and warm buckets for the index. The path must be both readable and writable.

remarks.para: This property's value may contain shell expansion terms.
Note: Splunk will not start if an index lacks a valid .

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.HomePathExpanded
member.summary: Gets the expanded absolute path to both hot and warm buckets for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.IndexThreads
member.summary: Gets the number of threads for this index.
member.remarks: This property's value can be either a number or the keyword "auto".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.LastInitTime
member.summary: Gets the last initialization time for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxBloomBackfillBucketAge
member.summary: Gets or sets a time that indicates a bucket age. When a warm or cold bucket is older than this, Splunk does not create or rebuild its bloomfilter.

remarks.para: The valid format is number followed by a time unit ("s", "m", "h", or "d"). For example, "30d" indicates 30 days.
When this property is set to "0", Splunk never rebuilds bloom filters.
This property's default value is "30d".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxConcurrentOptimizes
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent optimize processes that can run against a hot bucket for this index.

remarks.para: This number should be increased from the default only if instructed by Splunk Support.
This property's default value is "3".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxDataSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size in megabytes (MB) for a hot database to reach before triggering a roll from hot to warm buckets for this index.

remarks.para: Acceptable values are also "auto" or "auto_high_volume".

list.item: "auto_high_volume" sets the size to 10 gigabytes (GB) on 64-bit, and 1GB on 32-bit systems

remarks.para: A "high volume index" would typically be considered one that gets over 10GB of data per day.

Although the maximum value to which you can set this property is 1048576MB, which corresponds to 1 terabyte (TB), a reasonable number ranges anywhere from 100 to 50000. Any number outside this range should be approved by Splunk Support before proceeding.
If you specify an invalid number or string, will be auto tuned.
Note: The precise size of your warm buckets may vary from , due to post-processing and timing issues with the rolling policy.
This property's default value is "auto".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxHotBuckets
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of hot buckets for this index.

remarks.para: When is exceeded, Splunk rolls the least recently used (LRU) hot bucket to warm. Both normal hot buckets and quarantined hot buckets count towards this total. This setting operates independently of , which can also cause hot buckets to roll.
This property's default value is "3".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxHotIdleSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum life of a hot bucket, in seconds.
member.remarks:
If a hot bucket exceeds this property's value, Splunk rolls the bucket to warm. This setting operates independently of , which can also cause hot buckets to roll.
A value of "0" turns off the idle check, and indicates an infinite lifetime.
This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxHotSpanSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper bound of target maximum timespan of hot and warm buckets for this index, in seconds.

remarks.para: Note: If you set this property too small, you can get an explosion of hot/warm buckets in the filesystem. The system sets a lower bound implicitly for this parameter at 3600, but this is an advanced parameter that should be set with care and understanding of the characteristics of your data.
This property's default value is "7776000" (90 days).

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxMemMB
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of memory, expressed in megabytes (MB), to allocate for buffering a single tsidx file into memory before flushing to disk.

remarks.para: This property's default value ("5") is recommended for all environments.
Important: Calculate this number carefully. Setting this number incorrectly may have adverse effects on your system's memory and splunkd stability and performance.
This property's default value is "5".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxMetaEntries
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of unique lines in .data files in a bucket, which may help to reduce memory consumption.

remarks.para: If set to "0", this setting is ignored (it is treated as infinite).

If this property's value is exceeded, a hot bucket is rolled to prevent further increase. If your buckets are rolling due to Strings.data hitting this limit, the culprit may be the punct field in your data. If you don't use punct, it may be best to simply disable this (see props.conf.spec in $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system/README). There is a small time delta between when maximum is exceeded and bucket is rolled. This means a bucket may end up with epsilon more lines than specified, but this is not a major concern unless the excess is significant.
This property's default value is "1000000".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxRunningProcessGroups
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of concurrent helper processes for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxTime
member.summary: Gets timestamp of the newest event time in the index.
member.remarks: If this value is not available, the system's concept of minimum time is returned.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxTimeUnreplicatedNoAcks
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper limit, in seconds, on how long an event can sit in raw slice.

remarks.para: This property applies only if replication is enabled for this index; otherwise it is ignored.
If there are any acknowledged events sharing this raw slice, this property does not apply, and applies.
This property's highest legal value is "2147483647".
To disable this property, set it to "0".
Be aware that this is an advanced parameter. Understand the consequences before changing.
This property is available starting in Splunk 5.0.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxTimeUnreplicatedWithAcks
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper limit, in seconds, on how long an event can sit unacknowledged in raw slice.

remarks.para: This property applies only when indexer acknowledgement is enabled on forwarders and replication is enabled with clustering.
This property's highest legal value is "2147483647".
To disable this parameter, set this property to "0".
Be aware that this is an advanced parameter. Understand the consequences before changing.
This property is available in Splunk 5.0 and later.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxTotalDataSizeMB
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of an index, in megabytes (MB).

remarks.para: If an index grows larger than the maximum size, the oldest data is frozen.
This property's default value is "500000".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MaxWarmDBCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of warm buckets for this index.

remarks.para: If this property's value is exceeded, the warm buckets with the lowest value for their latest times are moved to cold.
This property's default value is "300".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MemPoolMB
member.summary: Gets the memory pool size for this index.
member.remarks: This property's value can be a number or the keyword "auto".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MinRawFileSyncSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets how frequently splunkd forces a filesystem sync while compressing journal slices for this index.

remarks.para: During the interval specified by this property, uncompressed slices are left on disk even after they are compressed. Then splunkd forces a filesystem sync of the compressed journal and removes the accumulated uncompressed files.
If this property is set to "0", splunkd forces a filesystem sync after every slice completes compressing.
If this property is set to "disable", syncing is disabled entirely; uncompressed slices are removed as soon as compression is complete.
Note: Some filesystems are very inefficient at performing sync operations, so only enable this if you are sure it is needed.
This property's default value is "disable".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.MinTime
member.summary: Gets the timestamp of the oldest event time in the index.
member.remarks: If this value is not available, the system's concept of minimum time is returned.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.NumHotBuckets
member.summary: Gets the number of hot buckets that were created for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.NumWarmBuckets
member.summary: Gets the umber of warm buckets that were created for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.NumBloomfilters
member.summary: Gets the number of bloom filters that were created for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.PartialServiceMetaPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency, in seconds, at which metadata is partially synced (synced in-place) for this index.

remarks.para: If set, this property's value indicates the frequency at which metadata is synchronized, but only for records where the sync can be done efficiently in place, without requiring a full rewrite of the metadata file. Records that require a full rewrite are synchronized at an interval defined by the property.
When this property is set to a value of "0", partial syncing is disabled, so metadata is only synced on an interval defined by the property.
If the value of this property is greater than that of the property, then this property has no effect.
This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.QuarantineFutureSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets the future event-time quarantine for this index. Events that are newer than now plus this value are quarantined.
member.remarks: This property's default value is "2592000" (30 days).

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.QuarantinePastSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets the past event-time quarantine for this index. Events that are older than now minus this value are quarantined.
member.remarks: This property's default value is "77760000" (900 days).

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.RawChunkSizeBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the target uncompressed size of individual raw slices in the raw data journal for this index.

remarks.para: Warning: This is an advanced property. Only change it if you are instructed to do so by Splunk Support.
This property only specifies a target chunk size. The actual chunk size may be slightly larger by an amount proportional to an individual event size.
This property's default value is 131072 (128 kilobytes (KB)).

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ReplicationFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the replication factor.

remarks.para: Valid values for this property are either a non-negative number or the "auto" keyword.
A value of "auto" instructs Splunk to use the value as configured with the master.
A value of "0" turns off replication for this index.
This parameter only applies to Splunk clustering slaves.
This property is available starting in Splunk 5.0.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.RotatePeriodInSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency to check for the need to create a new hot bucket and the need to roll or freeze any warm or cold buckets for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ServiceMetaPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency, in seconds, at which metadata is synced to disk for this index.

remarks.para: You may want to set this to a larger value if the sum of your metadata file sizes is larger than many tens of megabytes, to avoid the hit on I/O in the indexing fast path.
This property's default value is "25".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.SuppressBannerList
member.summary: Gets a comma separated list of indexes that suppress "index missing" messages.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.Sync
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the number of events that trigger the indexer to sync events.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.SyncMeta
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the sync operation is invoked before the file descriptor is closed on metadata updates.

remarks.para: This functionality improves integrity of metadata files, especially in regards to operating system crashes or machine failures.
Warning: This is an advanced parameter. Only change it if you are instructed to do so by Splunk Support.
This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ThawedPath
member.summary: Gets an absolute filesystem path, local to the server, that contains the thawed (resurrected) databases for the index.

remarks.para: Be aware that Splunk will not start if an index lacks a valid .
This property's value may contain shell expansion terms.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ThawedPathExpanded
member.summary: Gets the expanded absolute path to the thawed index for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.ThrottleCheckPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency at which Splunk checks for an index throttling condition.

remarks.para: This property's value should be changed from the default only if instructed by Splunk Support.
This property's default value is "15".

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.TotalEventCount
member.summary: Gets the total event count for this index.

member.name: P:Splunk.Index.IsInternal
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this index is an internal index.

member.name: T:Splunk.IndexArgs
member.summary: The class extends for creation-specific properties.

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.AssureUTF8
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether all data retrieved from the index is proper UTF8.

remarks.para: Note: When enabled indexing, performance will degrade.
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.BlockSignSize
member.summary: Sets the block sign size for this index.

remarks.para: This value defines the number of events that make up a block for block signatures.
If this property is set to "0", block signing is disabled for this index.
This property's recommended value is "100".
This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.BucketRebuildMemoryHint
member.summary: Sets the suggested Splunk bucket rebuild process for the size of the time-series (tsidx) file to make.

remarks.para: Caution: This is an advanced parameter. Inappropriate use of this parameter causes splunkd to not start if rebuild is required. Do not set this parameter unless instructed by Splunk Support.
This property's default value is "auto".
This property is available starting in Splunk 5.0.

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.ColdPath
member.summary: Sets an absolute filesystem path, local to the server, to the cold database for the index. The path must be both readable and writable.

remarks.para: Cold databases are opened as needed when searching. May be defined in terms of a volume definition (see volume).
This property's value may contain shell expansion terms.
Be aware that Splunk will not start if an index lacks a valid .

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.ColdToFrozenDir
member.summary: Sets the destination filesystem path, local to the server, for the frozen archive. Splunk automatically puts frozen buckets in this directory.

remarks.para: Use as an alternative to a .
Bucket freezing policy is as follows:

list.item: New style buckets (4.2 and on): removes all files but the rawdata. To thaw, run splunk rebuild "bucket dir" on the bucket, then move to the thawed directory.
Old style buckets (Pre-4.2): gzip all the .data and .tsidx files. To thaw, gunzip the zipped files and move the bucket into the thawed directory for that index.

remarks.para: Note: If both the and properties are specified, the property takes precedence.

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.ColdToFrozenScript
member.summary: Sets the filesystem path, local to the server, that is the archiving script.

remarks.para: Bucket freezing policy is as follows:

list.item: New style buckets (4.2 and on): removes all files but the rawdata. To thaw, run splunk rebuild "bucket dir" on the bucket, then move to the thawed directory. Use the unless you need to perform a more advanced operation upon freezing buckets.
Old style buckets (Pre-4.2): gzip all the .data and .tsidx files. To thaw, gunzip the zipped files and move the bucket into the thawed directory for that index.

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.EnableOnlineBucketRepair
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether asynchronous (online fsck) bucket repair is enabled. When enabled, bucket repair runs concurrently with Splunk.

remarks.para: When this feature is enabled, you don't have to wait for buckets to be repaired before starting Splunk, but you might notice a slight degradation in performance as a result.
This property's default value is "enabled".

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.FrozenTimePeriodInSecs
member.summary: Sets the number of seconds after which indexed data rolls to frozen.

remarks.para: Freezing data means it is removed from the index. If archiving is necessary for frozen data, see the ColdToFrozen attributes, and .
This property's default value is "188697600" (6 years).

member.name: P:Splunk.IndexArgs.HomePath

remarks.para: This property's value may contain shell expansion terms.

member.name: T:Splunk.Input
member.summary: The class is the base class from which all specific inputs are derived.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the unknown input kind. Must be overridden in sub-classes.

member.summary: The class represents a collection of inputs. The collection is heterogeneous and each member contains an value indicating the specific type of input.
member.typeparam: The Input class and its derived classes.

member.name: F:Splunk.InputCollection.inputKinds
member.summary: The dynamic list of input kinds. The list is dynamic to deal with modular inputs.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Assembles the input kind list by refreshing from the server.

member.name: M:Splunk.InputCollection.ContainsKey(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this key is in the current list of Inputs.
member.returns: Whether this key is in the current list of inputs.

member.name: M:Splunk.InputCollection.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Not supported. Creates a stub for a new data input.
member.returns: Will not return, but throw an exception.

member.name: M:Splunk.InputCollection.Create(System.String,Splunk.Args)
member.summary: Not supported. A stub for create.
member.returns: Will not return, but throw an exception.

member.name: M:Splunk.InputCollection.Create(System.String,Splunk.InputKind)
member.summary: Creates a new data input based on the input kind.
member.param: The kind of input to create.

member.summary: Creates a new data input based on the input kind and additional arguments.
member.param: The kind of input to create.

member.summary: Creates a new data input based on an Atom entry.
member.param: The Atom data representing the object.

member.summary: Returns an Input from the current list of inputs.

member.summary: Returns a scoped, namespace-constrained input from the current list of inputs.

member.name: M:Splunk.InputCollection.ItemKind(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the input kind for a given path.

member.name: M:Splunk.InputCollection.MatchesInputName(Splunk.InputKind,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether a given string matches the input name (string equality). For scripted inputs, which are listed by their full path, this method compares only the final component of the filename for a match.
member.returns: Whether the match succeeded or failed.

member.name: T:Splunk.JobArgs
member.summary: The class extends for creation properties.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.AutoCancel
member.summary: Sets the auto-cancel frequency check, in seconds.

remarks.para: Setting this property to "0" indicates never auto-cancel.
This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.AutoFinalizeEventCount
member.summary: Sets the auto-finalize counter.

remarks.para: When at least these many events have been processed, the job is finalized.
Setting this property to "0" indicates there is no limit.
This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.AutoPause
member.summary: Sets the auto-pause frequency check, in seconds.

remarks.para: Setting this property to "0" indicates never auto-pause.
This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.EarliestTime
member.summary: Sets the inclusive earliest time bounds for the search.
member.remarks: Be aware that although this property's value is a time stamp, it is left as a string to support Splunk relative time format-- for instance, "+2d", which specifies two days from now.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.EnableLookups
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether lookups should be applied to events.

remarks.para: Setting this propery to true may slow searches significantly, depending on the nature of the lookups.
This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.ExecutionMode
member.summary: Sets the search execution mode.
member.remarks: This property's valid values are any of the following keywords: "blocking", "oneshot", "normal".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.ForceBundleReplication
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether this search should cause (and wait depending on the value of sync_bundle_replication) bundle synchronization with all search peers.
member.remarks: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.Id
member.summary: Sets the search ID.
member.remarks: If this property is not set, a random ID is generated.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.LatestTime
member.summary: Sets the exclusive latest time bounds for the search.
member.remarks: Be aware that although this property's value is a time stamp, it is left as a string to support Splunk relative time format-- for instance, "+2d", which specifies two days from now.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.MaxCount
member.summary: Sets the number of events that can be accessible in any given status bucket.

remarks.para: When a search is transformed, this property indicates the maximum number of events to store. Specifically, in all calls, codeoffset + count <= max_count.
This property's default value is "1000".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.Now
member.summary: Sets the absolute time for any relative time specifier in the search.

remarks.para: Be aware that although this property's value is a time stamp, it is left as a string to support Splunk relative time format-- for instance, "+2d", which specifies two days from now.
This property's default value is the current system time.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.ReduceFreq
member.summary: Sets the MapReduce reduce phase on accumulated map values frequency, in seconds.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.ReloadMacros
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether to reload macro definitions from macros.conf.
member.remarks: This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.RemoteServerList
member.summary: Sets a list of (possibly wildcarded) servers from which to pull raw events.
member.remarks: This same server list is used in subsearches.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.Rf
member.summary: Sets the list of required fields returned in the search.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.RtBlocking
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the indexer blocks if the queue for this search is full.

remarks.para: This property only applies to real-time searches.
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.RtIndexfilter
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the indexer prefilters the events.

remarks.para: This property only applies to real-time searches.
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.RtMaxblockSeconds
member.summary: Sets the maximum time to block, in seconds.

remarks.para: This property only applies to real-time searches when the property is set to true.
This property's default value is "60".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.RtQueueSize
member.summary: Sets the queue size, in number of events, the indexer should use for this search.
member.para: This property only applies to real-time searches.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.SearchListener
member.summary: Sets a search state listener with the search.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.SearchMode
member.summary: Sets the search mode.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.SpawnProcess
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the search should run in a separate spawned process.

remarks.para: Be aware that searches against indexes must run in a separate process.
This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.StatusBuckets
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of buckets to create.

remarks.para: Setting this property to "0" causes no timeline information to be generated.
This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.SyncBundleReplication
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether this search should wait for bundle replication to complete.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.TimeFormat
member.summary: Sets the time format string, used to convert a formatted time string from {start,end}_time into UTC seconds.
member.remarks: This property's default value is "ISO-8601".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobArgs.Timeout
member.summary: Sets the number of seconds to keep this search after processing has stopped.
member.remarks: This property's default value is "86400" (24 hours).

member.name: T:Splunk.JobArgs.ExecutionModeEnum
member.summary:
Specifies how to create a job using the
method.

member.name: F:Splunk.JobArgs.ExecutionModeEnum.Normal
member.summary: Runs a search asynchronously and returns a search job immediately.

member.name: F:Splunk.JobArgs.ExecutionModeEnum.Blocking
member.summary: Runs a search synchronously and does not return a search job until the search has finished.

member.name: F:Splunk.JobArgs.ExecutionModeEnum.Oneshot
member.summary: Runs a blocking search that is scheduled to run immediately, and then returns the results of the search once completed.

member.name: T:Splunk.JobArgs.SearchModeEnum
member.summary:
Specifies how to create a job using the
method.

member.name: F:Splunk.JobArgs.SearchModeEnum.Normal
member.summary: Searches historical data.

summary.para: Searches live data. A realtime search may also be specified by setting the and properties to begin with "rt", even if the is set to "normal" or is not set.
If both the and properties are set to "rt", the search represents all appropriate live data that was received since the start of the search.

If both the and properties are set to "rt" followed by a relative time specifier, a sliding window is used where the time bounds of the window are determined by the relative time specifiers and are continuously updated based on current time.

member.name: T:Splunk.JobEventsArgs
member.summary: The class contains arguments for getting job results using the method.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobEventsArgs.Count
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of results to return.

remarks.para: To return all available results, set this property to "0".
This property's default value is "100".

member.name: P:Splunk.JobEventsArgs.EarliestTime
member.summary: Sets the earliest time in the time range to search.

remarks.para: This property's value is a time string. The time string can be a UTC time (with fractional seconds), a relative time specifier (to now), or a formatted time string.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobEventsArgs.FieldList
member.summary: Sets a list of fields to return for the event set.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobEventsArgs.LatestTime
member.summary: Sets the latest time in the time range to search.

remarks.para: This property's value is a time string. The time string can be a UTC time (with fractional seconds), a relative time specifier (to now), or a formatted time string.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobEventsArgs.MaximumLines
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of lines that any single event's _raw field should contain.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobEventsArgs.Offset
member.summary: Sets the index of the first result (inclusive) from which to begin returning data. This value is 0-indexed.

remarks.para: Starting in Splunk 4.1, negative offsets are allowed and are added to the count to compute the absolute offset (for example, offset=-1 is the last available offset). Offsets in the results are always absolute and never negative.
This property's default value is "0".

member.summary: Sets the format of the output.

member.summary: Sets an expression to convert a formatted time string from {start,end}_time into UTC seconds. The default format is "%m/%d/%Y:%H:%M:%S".

member.summary: Sets the number of seconds of inactivity after which to automatically cancel a job.

member.summary: Sets the number of events to process after which to auto-finalize the search.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.AutoPause
member.summary: Sets the number of seconds of inactivity after which to automatically pause a job.
member.remarks: Setting this property to "0" indicates never auto-pause.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.EarliestTime
member.summary: Sets the earliest time in the time range to search.

remarks.para: This property's value is a time string. The time string can be a UTC time (with fractional seconds), a relative time specifier (to now), or a formatted time string.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.EnableLookups
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether to enable lookups for this search.
member.remarks: Enabling lookups might slow searches significantly depending on the nature of the lookups.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.ForceBundleReplication
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether this search should cause (and wait depending on the value of ) bundle synchronization with all search peers.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.LatestTime
member.summary: Specifies the latest time in the time range to search.

remarks.para: This property's value is a time string. The time string can be a UTC time (with fractional seconds), a relative time specifier (to now), or a formatted time string.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.MaximumTime
member.summary: Sets the number of seconds to run this search before finalizing.
member.remarks: Setting this property to "0" indicates never finalize.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.Namespace
member.summary: Sets the application namespace in which to restrict searches.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.Now
member.summary: Specifies a time string that sets the absolute time used for any relative time specifier in the search.

remarks.para: You can specify a relative time modifier for this property. For example, specify +2d to specify the current time plus two days. If you specify a relative time modifier both in this parameter and in the search string, the search string modifier takes precedence.
For information about relative time modifiers, see Time modifiers for search in the Search Reference.
This property's default value is the current system time.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.ReduceFrequency
member.summary: Sets the time to wait between running the MapReduce phase on accumulated map values.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.ReloadMacros
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether to reload macro definitions from the macros.conf configuration file.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.RemoteServerList
member.summary: Sets a list of (possibly wildcarded) servers from which to pull raw events.
member.remarks: This same server list is used in subsearches.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.RequiredFieldList
member.summary: Sets one or more required fields to the search.
member.remarks: These fields, even if not referenced or used directly by the search, are still included by the events and summary endpoints. Splunk Web uses these fields to prepopulate panels in the Search view.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.RealtimeBlocking
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the indexer blocks if the queue for this search is full.
member.remarks: This property only applies to real-time searches.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.RealtimeIndexFilter
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the indexer pre-filters events.
member.remarks: This property only applies to real-time searches.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.RealtimeMaximumBlockSeconds
member.summary: Sets the number of seconds indicating the maximum time to block.
member.remarks: Setting this property to "0" indicates no limit. For real-time searches with the property set to true.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.RealtimeQueueSize
member.summary: Sets the queue size (in events) that the indexer should use for this search.
member.remarks: This property only applies to real-time searches.

member.name: P:Splunk.JobExportArgs.SearchListener
member.summary: Sets a string that registers a search state listener with the search.

remarks.para:
Use the format:
search_state;results_condition;http_method;uri;

For example:
search_listener=onResults;true;POST;/servicesNS/admin/search/saved/search/foobar/notify;

member.name: F:Splunk.JobExportArgs.SearchModeEnum.Normal
member.summary: Searches historical data.

member.name: F:Splunk.JobExportArgs.SearchModeEnum.Realtime
member.summary:
Searches live data. A real-time search may also be specified by setting the "earliest_time" and "latest_time" parameters to begin with "rt", even if the search_mode is set to "normal" or is not set.
If both the "earliest_time" and "latest_time" parameters are set to "rt", the search represents all appropriate live data that was received since the start of the search.
If both the "earliest_time" and "latest_time" parameters are set to "rt" followed by a relative time specifier, a sliding window is used where the time bounds of the window are determined by the relative time specifiers and are continuously updated based on current time.

member.name: M:Splunk.ModularInputs.Script.Run``1(System.String[])
member.summary: Performs the action specified by the args parameter.

remarks.para: If the args are not in the supported set of values, the method will do nothing and return a non-zero code (for instance, "1"), without raising an exception.
Any exceptions and internal progress messages when executing this method will be logged to the splunkd log.

member.typeparam: The application-derived type of the . It must have a constructor without a parameter.
member.param: Command-line arguments provided by Splunk when it invokes the modular input script (that is, executable). An application should pass the args of the Main method (that is, the executable entry point) into this method.
member.returns: Exit code, which should be used as the return value of the Main method. A value of "0" indicates success.

member.name: M:Splunk.ResultsReaderXml.GetEventsFromCurrentSet
member.summary: Returns an enumerator over a set of the events in the event stream, and gets ready for the next set.

remarks.para: When using 'search/jobs/export endpoint', search results will be streamed back as they become available. It is possible for one or more previews to be received before the final one. The enumerator returned will be over a single preview or the final results. Each time this method is called, the next preview or the final results are enumerated if they are available; otherwise, an exception is thrown.

After all events in the set is enumerated, the metadata of the next set (if available) is read, with
and being set accordingly.

member.name: T:Splunk.RoleArgs
member.summary: The class extends for creation properties.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.Capabilities
member.summary: Sets the capabilities of this role, as a list.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.DefaultApp
member.summary: Sets the name of the app to use as the default app for the role.
member.remarks: A user-specific default app will override this. The name you specify is the name of the folder containing the app.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.ImportedRoles
member.summary: Sets a role from which to import attributes, as a list.
member.remarks: This property's default value is a role that imports no other roles.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.RtSrchJobsQuota
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of concurrent real time search jobs for this role.
member.remarks: This count does not affect the normal search jobs limit.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.SrchDiskQuota
member.summary: Sets the maximum disk space, in megabytes (MB), that can be used by a user's search jobs. For example, 100 limits this role to 100MB total.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.SrchFilter
member.summary: Sets a search string that restricts the scope of searches run by this role.

remarks.para: Search results for this role only show events that also match the search string you specify. In the case that a user has multiple roles with different search filters, they are combined with an OR. The search string can include source, host, index, eventtype, sourcetype, search fields, *, OR, and AND. For example: "host=web* OR source=/var/log/*"
Note: You can also use the and parameters to limit the search on indexes.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.SrchIndexesAllowed
member.summary: Sets the index(es) this role has permissions to search.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.SrchIndexesDefault
member.summary: Sets the indexes to search when no index is specified.
member.remarks: These indexes can be wildcarded, with the exception that '*' does not match internal indexes. To match internal indexes, start with '_'. All internal indexes are represented by '_*'.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.SrchJobsQuota
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of concurrent searches a user with this role is allowed to run. In the event of many roles per user, the maximum of these quotas is applied.

member.name: P:Splunk.RoleArgs.SrchTimeWin
member.summary: Sets the maximum time span of a search, in seconds.
member.remarks: By default, searches are not limited to any specific time window. To override any search time windows from imported roles, set to "0", as the admin role does.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailAuthPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to use when authenticating with the SMTP server.
member.remarks: This property's default value is the empty string.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailAuthUsername
member.summary: Gets or sets the username to use when authenticating with the SMTP server.
member.remarks: This property's default value is the empty string.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailBcc
member.summary: Gets or sets the blind carbon copy (BCC) email address receiving alerts.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailCc
member.summary: Gets or sets the carbon copy (CC) email address receiving alerts.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the search command (or pipeline) that runs the action.
member.remarks: Generally, the search command is a template search pipeline that is realized with values from the saved search. To reference saved search field values, wrap them in a '$' symbol. For example, use $name$ to reference the saved search name, or use $search$ to reference the search query.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of text in the email.
member.remarks: This value also applies to any attachments formats. Valid values are: "plain", "html", "raw", and "csv".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the email address from which the email action originates.
member.remarks: The default is splunk@$LOCALHOST, or whatever value is set in alert_actions.conf.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailHostname
member.summary: Gets or sets the host name used in the web link (URL) that is sent in email alerts.
member.remarks:
This property's value can be in either of two forms:
hostname (for example, "splunkserver", "splunkserver.example.com")
protocol://hostname:port (for example, "http://splunkserver:8000", "https://splunkserver.example.com:443")
When set to a simple hostname, the protocol and port that are configured within Splunk are used to construct the base of the URL. When set to 'http://...', it is used verbatim. This means the correct port must be specified if it is not the default port for http or https. This is useful in cases in which the Splunk server is not aware of how to construct a URL that can be externally referenced, such as single sign on (SSO) environments, other proxies, or when the Splunk server hostname is not generally resolvable.
When this property is set to an empty string, the default behavior is used.
This property's default value is the current hostname provided by the operating system, or "localhost".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailInline
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the search results are contained in the body of the email.
member.remarks: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailMailServer
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the SMTP server that is used to send the emails, in the form <host>[:<port>].

remarks.para: <host> can be either the hostname or the IP address.
<port> is optional, and specifies the SMTP port that Splunk should connect to.
If this property is not set, it defaults to the setting defined in the alert_actions.conf file, or, if not set, to "$LOCALHOST:25".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailMaxResults
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of search results to send in email alerts.
member.remarks: This property's default value is "100".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailMaxTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time an email action takes before the action is canceled.

remarks.para: The property value's valid format is an integer followed by a time unit ("s" for seconds, "m" for minutes, "h" for hours, or "d" for days). For instance, "2s" means 2 seconds.
This property's default value is "5m".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailPdfView
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the PDF view to deliver.
member.remarks: This property is only valid if the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailPreProcessResults
member.summary: Gets or sets a search string for preprocessing results before emailing them.

remarks.para: Preprocessing usually involves filtering out unwanted internal fields.
This property's default value is an empty string, which indicates no preprocessing.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailReportCIDFontList
member.summary: Gets or sets a space-delimited list of character-identified (CID) fonts for handling some Asian languages in integrated PDF rendering.

remarks.para:
The fonts that can be listed include the following:
gb: Simplified Chinese
cns: Traditional Chinese
jp: Japanese
kor: Korean
If multiple fonts provide a glyph for a given character code, the glyph from the first font specified in the list is used.
To skip loading any CID fonts, specify an empty string.
This property's default value is "gb cns jp kor".
This property is available in Splunk 5.0 and later.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailReportIncludeSplunkLogo
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include the Splunk logo with the report.
member.remarks: This property is available in Splunk 5.0 and later.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailReportPaperOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the paper orientation.

remarks.para: Valid values for this property are "portrait" and "landscape".
This property's default value is "portrait".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailReportPaperSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the paper size for PDFs.

remarks.para: Valid values for this property are "letter", "legal", "ledger", "a2", "a3", "a4", and "a5".
This property's default value is "letter".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailReportServerEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the PDF server is enabled.
member.remarks: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailReportServerUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the PDF report server, if one is set up and available on the network.
member.remarks: This property's default value for a locally installed report server is "http://localhost:8091/".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailSendPdf
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create and send the results in PDF format.
member.remarks: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailSendResults
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether search results are attached to an email.
member.para: Results can be either attached or inline. For more information, see .
member.remarks: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailSubject

member.remarks: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionEmailTtl
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum time-to-live (TTL), in seconds, of search artifacts if this email action is triggered.

remarks.para: If the value is a number followed by "p", it is the number of scheduled search periods.
If no actions are triggered, the artifacts will have their TTL determined by the "dispatch.ttl" attribute in savedsearches.conf.
This property's default value is "86400" (equal to 24 hours).

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum time-to-live (TTL) of search artifacts if this summary-index action is triggered.

remarks.para: If the value is a number followed by "p", it is the number of scheduled search periods.
This property's default value is "10p".
If no actions are triggered, the artifacts will have their TTL determined by the "dispatch.ttl" attribute in savedsearches.conf.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertDigestMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Splunk applies the alert actions to the entire result set (digest) or to each individual search result (per result).

remarks.para: This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertExpires
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time to show the alert in the dashboard. The valid format is a number followed by a time unit ("s", "m", "h", or "d").

remarks.para: The property value's valid format is an integer followed by a time unit ("s" for seconds, "m" for minutes, "h" for hours, or "d" for days). For instance, "2s" means 2 seconds.
This property's default value is "24h".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertSeverity
member.summary: Gets or sets the alert severity level.

remarks.para:
The property's value can be one of the following integers:
"1" indicates DEBUG
"2" indicates INFO
"3" indicates WARN
"4" indicates ERROR
"5" indicates SEVERE
"6" indicates FATAL
This property's default value is "3".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertSuppress
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether alert suppression is enabled for this search.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertSuppressFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a comma-delimited list of fields to use for alert suppression when doing per-result alerting.

remarks.para: This property is required if suppression is turned on and per-result alerting is enabled.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertSuppressPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the suppression period, which is only valid if is enabled.

remarks.para: The property value's valid format is an integer followed by a time unit ("s" for seconds, "m" for minutes, "h" for hours, or "d" for days). For instance, "2s" means 2 seconds.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertTrack
member.summary: Gets or sets a keyword value indicating how to track the actions triggered by this saved search.

remarks.para:
This property's value can be one of the following keywords:
"true" indicates enabled
"false" indicates disabled
"auto" indicates that tracking is based on the setting of each action

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertComparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the alert comparator for alert triggering.

remarks.para:
This property's value can be one of the following strings:
"greater than"
"less than"
"equal to"
"rises by"
"drops by"
"rises by perc"
"drops by perc"
This property is used with to trigger alert actions.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertCondition
member.summary: Gets or sets a conditional search that is evaluated against the results of the saved search.

remarks.para: Alerts are triggered if the specified search yields a non-empty search result list.
This property's default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to compare to before triggering the alert action.

remarks.para: If this value is expressed as a percentage, it indicates the value to use when is set to "rises by perc" or "drops by perc."

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AlertType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what to base the alert on.

remarks.para:
This property's value can be one of the following strings:
"always"
"custom"
"number of events"
"number of hosts"
"number of sources"
This property is overridden by the property if specified.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.AutoSummarizeMaxSummaryRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum ratio of summary_size/bucket_size, which specifies when to stop summarization and deem it unhelpful for a bucket.

remarks.para: The test is only performed if the summary size is larger than 5 megabytes (MB).
This property's default value is "0.1".
This property is available in Splunk 5.0 and later.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.CronSchedule
member.summary: Gets or sets the cron-style schedule for running this saved search.

remarks.para: Use standard cron notation to define your scheduled search interval. The cron format can accept this type of notation: "00,20,40 * * * *", which runs the search every hour at hh:00, hh:20, and hh:40. Along the same lines, a cron of 03,23,43 * * * * runs the search every hour at hh:03, hh:23, hh:43.

Splunk recommends that you schedule your searches so that they are staggered over time. This reduces system load. Running all of them every 20 minutes (*/20) means they would all launch at hh:00 (20, 40) and might slow your system every 20 minutes.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a human-readable description of this saved search.

remarks.para: This property's default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchBuckets
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of timeline buckets.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchEarliestTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a time string that specifies the earliest time for this search.

remarks.para: This value can be a relative or absolute time as formatted by .

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchLatestTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a time string that specifies the latest time for this search.

remarks.para: This property's value can be a relative or absolute time as formatted by .

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchLookups
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether lookups are enabled for this search.

remarks.para: This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchMaxCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of results before finalizing the search.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "500000".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchMaxTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time in seconds before finalizing the search.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchReduceFreq
member.summary: Gets or sets an integer value that specifies how frequently Splunk runs the MapReduce reduce phase on accumulated map values.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "10".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchRtBackfill
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to backfill the real-time window for this search.

remarks.para: This property is only valid for real-time searches.
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchSpawnProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Splunk spawns a new search process when running this saved search.

remarks.para: Searches against indexes must run in a separate process.
This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchTimeFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a time format string that defines the time format used to specify the earliest and latest times for this search.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "%FT%T.%Q%:z".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchTtl
member.summary: Gets or sets the time to live (TTL) for the artifacts of the scheduled search (the time before the search job expires and artifacts are still available), if no actions are triggered.

remarks.para: If an action is triggered, Splunk changes the TTL to that action's TTL. If multiple actions are triggered, Splunk applies the maximum TTL to the artifacts.
If the value is a number followed by "p", it is the number of scheduled search periods.
This property's default value is "2p".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DisplayView
member.summary: Gets or sets the default UI view name (not label) in which to load the results.
member.remarks: Access is dependent on the user having sufficient permissions.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.MaxConcurrent
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent instances of this search the scheduler is allowed to run.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "1".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.NextScheduledTime
member.summary: Gets the time at which the scheduler will run this search again.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.QualifiedSearch
member.summary: Gets the exact search string that the scheduler will run.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.RealtimeSchedule
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the scheduler computes the next run time of a scheduled search.

remarks.para:
This property's possible values are the following:
"0" indicates the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled search on the last search execution time. This is called continuous scheduling. The scheduler will never skip scheduled execution periods. However, the execution of the saved search might fall behind depending on the scheduler's load. Use continuous scheduling whenever you enable the summary index option.
"1" indicates the scheduler is executing the searches running over the most recent time range, and therefore might skip some execution periods to keep up.
This property's default value is "1".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.RequestUiDispatchApp
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value specifying the app in which Splunk Web dispatches this search.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.RequestUiDispatchView
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value specifying the view in which Splunk Web displays this search.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.RestartOnSearchPeerAdd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a real-time search managed by the scheduler is restarted when a search peer becomes available for this saved search.

remarks.para: The peer can be a newly added peer or a peer that has been down and has become available.
This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.RunOnStartup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this search is run when Splunk starts.

remarks.para: If the search is not run on startup, it runs at the next scheduled time.
Splunk recommends that you set this property to true for scheduled searches that populate lookup tables.
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.Search
member.summary: Gets or sets the search expression for this saved search.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.Vsid
member.summary: Gets or sets the view state ID that is associated with the view specified in the property.

remarks.para: This ID corresponds to a stanza in the viewstates.conf configuration file.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the populate-lookup action is enabled.

remarks.para: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.IsActionRss
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether RSS action is enabled.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.IsActionScript

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the summary-index action is enabled.

remarks.para: This property's default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this search is run on a schedule.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.IsVisible

"summary_index"

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.ActionWildcard
member.summary: Sets a wildcard argument that accepts any action.

remarks.para: An example saved search template is "args.username=foobar" when the search is "search $username$".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.Disabled
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the saved search is disabled.

remarks.para: Disabled searches are not visible in Splunk Web.
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearch.DispatchWildcard
member.summary: Sets a wildcard argument that accepts any dispatch-related argument.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.DispatchBuckets
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of timeline buckets.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.DispatchEarliestTime
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of timeline buckets.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.DispatchTtl
member.summary: Sets the time to live (TTL) for the artifacts of the scheduled search (the time before the search job expires and artifacts are still available), if no actions are triggered.

remarks.para: If an action is triggered, Splunk changes the TTL to that action's TTL. If multiple actions are triggered, Splunk applies the maximum TTL to the artifacts.
If the value is a number followed by "p", it is the number of scheduled search periods.
This property's default value is "2p".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.TriggerActions
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether to trigger alert actions.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ForceDispatch
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether to start a new search, even if another instance of this search is already running.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionWildcard
member.summary: Sets the wildcard argument for any action.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailAuthPassword
member.summary: Sets the password to use when authenticating with the SMTP server.

remarks.para: Normally this value will be set when editing the email settings. However, you can set a clear text password here and it will be encrypted on the next Splunk restart.
This property's default value is the empty string.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailAuthUsername
member.summary: Sets the username to use when authenticating with the SMTP server.

remarks.para: If this is empty string, no authentication is attempted. Be aware that some SMTP servers reject unauthenticated emails.
This property's default value is the empty string.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailBcc
member.summary: Sets the blind carbon copy (BCC) email address to use.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailCc
member.summary: Sets the carbon copy (CC) email address to use.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailCommand
member.summary: Sets the search command (or pipeline) that runs the action.

remarks.para: Generally, the search command is a template search pipeline that is realized with values from the saved search. To reference saved search field values, wrap them in a '$' symbol. For example, use $name$ to reference the saved search name, or use $search$ to reference the search query.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailFormat
member.summary: Sets the format of text in the email.

remarks.para:
This value also applies to any attachments formats. Valid values are:
"plain"
"html"
"raw"
"csv"

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailFrom
member.summary: Sets the email address from which the email action originates.

remarks.para: The default is splunk@$LOCALHOST, or whatever value is set in alert_actions.conf.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailHostname
member.summary: Sets the hostname used in the web link (URL) that is sent in email actions.
member.remarks:
This property's value can be in either of two forms:
hostname (for example, "splunkserver", "splunkserver.example.com")
protocol://hostname:port (for example, "http://splunkserver:8000", "https://splunkserver.example.com:443")
When set to a simple hostname, the protocol and port that are configured within Splunk are used to construct the base of the URL. When set to 'http://...', it is used verbatim. This means the correct port must be specified if it is not the default port for http or https. This is useful in cases in which the Splunk server is not aware of how to construct a URL that can be externally referenced, such as single sign on (SSO) environments, other proxies, or when the Splunk server hostname is not generally resolvable.
When this property is set to an empty string, the default behavior is used.
This property's default value is the current hostname provided by the operating system, or "localhost".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailInline
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the search results are contained in the body of the email.
member.remarks: Results can be either inline or attached to an email. For more information, see .

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailMailServer
member.summary: Sets the address of the SMTP server that is used to send the emails, in the form <host>[:<port>].

remarks.para: <host> can be either the hostname or the IP address.
<port> is optional, and specifies the SMTP port that Splunk should connect to.
If this property is not set, it defaults to the setting defined in the alert_actions.conf file, or, if not set, to "$LOCALHOST:25".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailMaxResults
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of search results to send in email alerts.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "100".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailMaxTime
member.summary: Sets the maximum amount of time an email action takes before the action is canceled.

remarks.para: The property value's valid format is an integer followed by a time unit ("s" for seconds, "m" for minutes, "h" for hours, or "d" for days). For instance, "2s" means 2 seconds.
This property's default value is "5m".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailPdfView
member.summary: Sets the name of the view to deliver.

remarks.para: This property is only valid if the property is enabled.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailPreprocessResults
member.summary: Sets a search string for preprocessing results before emailing them.

remarks.para: Preprocessing usually involves filtering out unwanted internal fields.
This property's default value is an empty string, which indicates no preprocessing.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailReportPaperOrientation
member.summary: Sets the paper orientation.

remarks.para: Valid values for this property are "portrait" and "landscape".
This property's default value is "portrait".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailReportPaperSize
member.summary: Sets the paper size for PDFs.

remarks.para:
Valid values for this property are:
"letter"
"legal"
"ledger"
"a2"
"a3"
"a4"
"a5"
This property's default value is "letter".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailReportServerEnabled
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the PDF server is enabled.

remarks.para: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailReportServerUrl
member.summary: Sets the URL of the PDF report server, if one is set up and available on the network.

remarks.para: This property's default value for a locally installed report server is "http://localhost:8091/".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailSendPdf
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether to create and send the results in PDF format.

remarks.para: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailSendResults
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether search results are attached to an email.

remarks.para: Results can be either attached or inline. For more information, see .
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailSubject
member.summary: Sets the subject line of the email.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "SplunkAlert-<savedsearchname>".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailTo
member.summary: Sets a comma- or semicolon-delimited list of email recipients receiving alerts.

remarks.para: This value is required if this search is scheduled and the email alert action is enabled.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailTrackAlert
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether running this email action results in a trackable alert.

remarks.para: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailTtl
member.summary: Sets the minimum time-to-live (TTL), in seconds, of search artifacts if this email action is triggered.

remarks.para: If the value is a number followed by "p", it is the number of scheduled search periods.
If no actions are triggered, the artifacts will have their TTL determined by the "dispatch.ttl" attribute in savedsearches.conf.
This property's default value is "86400" (equal to 24 hours).

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailUseTls

remarks.para: This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionEmailWidthSortColumns

remarks.para: This property is only used when the property is set to "plain".
This property's default value is true.
