member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionRssTtl
member.summary: Sets the minimum time-to-live (TTL) of search artifacts if this RSS action is triggered.

remarks.para: If the value is a number followed by "p", it is the number of scheduled search periods.
If no actions are triggered, the artifacts will have their TTL determined by the "dispatch.ttl" attribute in savedsearches.conf.
This property's default value is "86400" (equal to 24 hours).

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionScriptCommand
member.summary: Sets the search command (or pipeline) that runs the action.

remarks.para: Generally the command is a template search pipeline that is realized with values from the saved search. To reference saved search field values, wrap them in the '$' symbol. For example, to reference the saved search name use $name$; to reference search use $search$.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionScriptFilename
member.summary: Sets the file name of the script to call.

remarks.para: This property is required if script action is enabled is set to true).

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionScriptHostname
member.summary: Sets the host name used in the web link (URL) that is sent in script alerts.
member.remarks:
This property's value can be in either of two forms:
hostname (for example, "splunkserver", "splunkserver.example.com")
protocol://hostname:port (for example, "http://splunkserver:8000", "https://splunkserver.example.com:443")
When set to a simple hostname, the protocol and port that are configured within Splunk are used to construct the base of the URL. When set to 'http://...', it is used verbatim. This means the correct port must be specified if it is not the default port for http or https. This is useful in cases in which the Splunk server is not aware of how to construct a URL that can be externally referenced, such as single sign on (SSO) environments, other proxies, or when the Splunk server hostname is not generally resolvable.
When this property is set to an empty string, the default behavior is used.
This property's default value is the current hostname provided by the operating system, or "localhost".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionScriptMaxResults
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of search results to send in script alerts.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "100".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionScriptMaxTime
member.summary: Sets the maximum amount of time a script action takes before the action is canceled.

remarks.para: The property value's valid format is an integer followed by a time unit ("s" for seconds, "m" for minutes, "h" for hours, or "d" for days). For instance, "2s" means 2 seconds.
This property's default value is "5m".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionScriptTrackAlert
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether running this script action results in a trackable alert.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionScriptTtl
member.summary: Sets the minimum time-to-live (TTL) of search artifacts if this script action is triggered.

remarks.para: If the value is a number followed by "p", it is the number of scheduled search periods.
If no actions are triggered, the artifacts will have their TTL determined by the "dispatch.ttl" attribute in savedsearches.conf.
This property's default value is "600" (equal to 10 minutes).

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActtionSummaryIndexName
member.summary: Sets the name of the summary index where the results of the scheduled search are saved.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "summary".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionSummaryIndexCommand
member.summary: Sets the search command (or pipeline) that runs the action.

remarks.para: Generally the command is a template search pipeline that is realized with values from the saved search. To reference saved search field values, wrap them in the '$' symbol. For example, to reference the saved search name use $name$; to reference search use $search$.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionSummaryIndexHostname
member.summary: Sets the host name used in the web link (URL) that is sent in summary-index alerts.
member.remarks:
This property's value can be in either of two forms:
hostname (for example, "splunkserver", "splunkserver.example.com")
protocol://hostname:port (for example, "http://splunkserver:8000", "https://splunkserver.example.com:443")
When set to a simple hostname, the protocol and port that are configured within Splunk are used to construct the base of the URL. When set to 'http://...', it is used verbatim. This means the correct port must be specified if it is not the default port for http or https. This is useful in cases in which the Splunk server is not aware of how to construct a URL that can be externally referenced, such as single sign on (SSO) environments, other proxies, or when the Splunk server hostname is not generally resolvable.
When this property is set to an empty string, the default behavior is used.
This property's default value is the current hostname provided by the operating system, or "localhost".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionSummaryIndexInline
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether to run the summary indexing action as part of the scheduled search.

remarks.para: This property is only considered if the summary-index action is enabled and is always executedthat is, if counttype = always.
This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionSummaryIndexMaxResults
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of search results to send in summary-index alerts.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "100".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionSummaryIndexMaxTime
member.summary: Sets the maximum amount of time a summary-index action takes before the action is canceled.

remarks.para: The property value's valid format is an integer followed by a time unit ("s" for seconds, "m" for minutes, "h" for hours, or "d" for days). For instance, "2s" means 2 seconds.
This property's default value is "5m".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionSummaryIndexTrackAlert
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether running this summary-index action results in a trackable alert.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.ActionSummaryIndexTtl
member.summary: Sets the minimum time-to-live (TTL) of search artifacts if this summary-index action is triggered.

remarks.para: If the value is a number followed by "p", it is the number of scheduled search periods.
If no actions are triggered, the artifacts will have their TTL determined by the "dispatch.ttl" attribute in savedsearches.conf.
This property's default value is "10p".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.Actions
member.summary: Sets a comma-separated list of actions to enable.

remarks.para:
This property's value can be one of the following strings:
"email"
"populate_lookup"
"rss"
"script"
"summary_index"

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertDigestMode
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether Splunk applies the alert actions to the entire result set (digest) or to each individual search result (per result).

remarks.para: This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertExpires
member.summary: Sets the amount of time to show the alert in the dashboard. The valid format is a number followed by a time unit ("s", "m", "h", or "d").

remarks.para: The property value's valid format is an integer followed by a time unit ("s" for seconds, "m" for minutes, "h" for hours, or "d" for days). For instance, "2s" means 2 seconds.
This property's default value is "24h".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertSeverity
member.summary: Sets the alert severity level.

remarks.para:
The property's value can be one of the following integers:
"1" indicates DEBUG
"2" indicates INFO
"3" indicates WARN
"4" indicates ERROR
"5" indicates SEVERE
"6" indicates FATAL
This property's default value is "3".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertSuppress
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether alert suppression is enabled for this search.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertSuppressFields
member.summary: Sets a comma-delimeted list of fields to use for alert suppression when doing per-result alerting.

remarks.para: This property is required if suppression is turned on and per-result alerting is enabled.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertSuppressPeriod
member.summary: Sets the suppression period, which is only valid if is enabled.

remarks.para: The property value's valid format is an integer followed by a time unit ("s" for seconds, "m" for minutes, "h" for hours, or "d" for days). For instance, "2s" means 2 seconds.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertTrack
member.summary: Sets a keyword value indicating how to track the actions triggered by this saved search.

remarks.para:
This property's value can be one of the following keywords:
"true" indicates enabled
"false" indicates disabled
"auto" indicates that tracking is based on the setting of each action

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertComparator
member.summary: Sets the alert comparator for alert triggering.

remarks.para:
This property's value can be one of the following strings:
"greater than"
"less than"
"equal to"
"rises by"
"drops by"
"rises by perc"
"drops by perc"
This property is used with to trigger alert actions.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertCondition
member.summary: Sets a conditional search that is evaluated against the results of the saved search.

remarks.para: Alerts are triggered if the specified search yields a non-empty search result list.
This property's default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertThreshold
member.summary: Sets the value to compare to before triggering the alert action.

remarks.para: If this value is expressed as a percentage, it indicates the value to use when is set to "rises by perc" or "drops by perc."

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.AlertType
member.summary: Sets a value indicating what to base the alert on.

remarks.para:
This property's value can be one of the following strings:
"always"
"custom"
"number of events"
"number of hosts"
"number of sources"
This property is overridden by the property if specified.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.CronSchedule
member.summary: Sets the cron-style schedule for running this saved search.

remarks.para: Use standard cron notation to define your scheduled search interval. The cron format can accept this type of notation: "00,20,40 * * * *", which runs the search every hour at hh:00, hh:20, and hh:40. Along the same lines, a cron of 03,23,43 * * * * runs the search every hour at hh:03, hh:23, and hh:43.

Splunk recommends that you schedule your searches so that they are staggered over time. This reduces system load. Running all of them every 20 minutes (*/20) means they would all launch at hh:00 (20, 40) and might slow your system every 20 minutes.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.Description
member.summary: Sets a human-readable description of this saved search.

remarks.para: This property's default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.Disabled
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the saved search is disabled.

remarks.para: Disabled searches are not visible in Splunk Web.
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.DispatchMaxCount
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of results before finalizing the search.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "500000".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.DispatchMaxTime
member.summary: Sets the maximum amount of time in seconds before finalizing the search.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "0".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.DispatchSpawnSubprocess
member.summary: Sets an integer value that specifies how frequently Splunk runs the search process when running this saved search.

remarks.para: Searches against indexes must run in a separate process.
This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.DisplayView
member.summary: Sets the default UI view name (not label) in which to load the results.

remarks.para: Access is dependent on the user having sufficient permissions.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.IsScheduled
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether this search is run on a schedule.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.IsVisible
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the search should be visible in the saved search list.

remarks.para: This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.MaxConcurrent
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of concurrent instances of this search the scheduler is allowed to run.

remarks.para: This property's default value is "1".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.RealtimeSchedule
member.summary: Sets a value indicating how the scheduler computes the next run time of a scheduled search.

remarks.para:
This property's possible values are the following:
"0" indicates the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled search on the last search execution time. This is called continuous scheduling. The scheduler will never skip scheduled execution periods. However, the execution of the saved search might fall behind depending on the scheduler's load. Use continuous scheduling whenever you enable the summary index option.
"1" indicates the scheduler is executing the searches running over the most recent time range, and therefore might skip some execution periods to keep up.
This property's default value is "1".

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.RequestUIDispatchApp
member.summary: Sets a string value specifying the app in which Splunk Web dispatches this search.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.RequestUIDispatchView
member.summary: Sets a string value specifying the view in which Splunk Web displays this search.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.RestartOnSearchPeerAdd
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether a real-time search managed by the scheduler is restarted when a search peer becomes available for this saved search.

remarks.para: The peer can be a newly added peer or a peer that has been down and has become available.
This property's default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.RunOnStartup
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether this search is run when Splunk starts.

remarks.para: If the search is not run on startup, it runs at the next scheduled time.
Splunk recommends that you set this property to true for scheduled searches that populate lookup tables.
This property's default value is false.

member.name: P:Splunk.SavedSearchDispatchArgs.VSID
member.summary: Sets the view state ID that is associated with the view specified in the property.

remarks.para: This ID corresponds to a stanza in the viewstates.conf configuration file.

member.summary: Sets the frequency of script execution.

remarks.para: This property's valid values are either an integer, in seconds, or a cron schedule. If a cron schedule is specified, the script is not executed on start-up.
This property's default value is 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Splunk.ScriptInputArgs.PassAuth
member.summary: Sets the user to run the script as. If you provide a username, Splunk generates an auth token for that user and passes it to the script.

member.name: P:Splunk.ScriptInputArgs.RenameSource
member.summary: Sets the new name for the source field for the script.

member.name: P:Splunk.ScriptInputArgs.Source
member.summary: Sets the source key's initial value for events from this input. As a convenience, the chosen string is prepended with "source::".

remarks.para: The key is used during parsing and indexing, in particular to set the source field during indexing. It is also the source field used at search time.

Overriding the source key is generally not recommended. Typically, the input layer provides a more accurate string to aid in problem analysis and investigation, accurately recording the file from which the data was retrieved. Consider use of source types, tagging, and search wildcards before overriding this value.
This property's default value is the input file path.

member.name: P:Splunk.ScriptInputArgs.SourceType
member.summary: Sets the sourcetype key's initial value for events from this input. If unset, Splunk picks a sourcetype based on various aspects of the data. As a convenience, the chosen string is prepended with "sourcetype::".

remarks.para: The key is used during parsing and indexing, in particular to set the sourcetype field during indexing. It is also the source type field used at search time. Primarily used to explicitly declare the source type for this data, as opposed to allowing it to be determined via automated methods. This is typically important both for searchability and for applying the relevant configuration for this type of data during parsing and indexing.
This property has no default value.

"dns" sets the host to the reverse DNS entry for the IP address of the remote server sending data.
"none" leaves the host as specified in inputs.conf, which is typically the Splunk system hostname.
This property's default value is "ip".

member.summary: Sets the host from which the indexer gets data.

member.summary: Sets the index in which to store all event receieved by this input. The default is "default".

member.name: P:Splunk.UdpInputArgs.NoAppendingTimestamp
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether Splunk prepends a timestamp and host name to incoming events.

member.name: P:Splunk.UdpInputArgs.NoPriorityStripping
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether Splunk removes the priority field from incoming syslog events.

member.name: P:Splunk.UdpInputArgs.Queue
member.summary: Sets where the input processor should deposit the events it reads. Valid values are "parsingQueue" or "indexQueue". The default value is "parsingQueue".

remarks.para:
This property's valid values are:
"parsingQueue" applies props.conf and other parsing rules to your data. For more information about props.conf and rules for timestamping and linebreaking, refer to the Edit inputs.conf topic in the Getting Data In manual.
"indexQueue" sends your data directly into the index.
This property's default value is "parsingQueue".

member.name: P:Splunk.UdpInputArgs.RestrictToHost
member.summary: Sets an input restriction to only allow this host to post data.

member.name: P:Splunk.UdpInputArgs.Source
member.summary: Sets the source key's initial value. The key is used during parsing/indexing, in particular to set the source field during indexing. It is also the source field used at search time. As a convenience, the chosen string is prepended with 'source::'.

remarks.para: Overriding the source key is generally not recommended. Typically, the input layer provides a more accurate string to aid in problem analysis and investigation, accurately recording the file from which the data was retrieved. Consider use of source types, tagging, and search wildcards before overriding this value.
This property's default value is the input file path.

member.name: P:Splunk.UdpInputArgs.SourceType
member.summary: Sets the source type for events from this input.
member.remarks:
This property's default value is:
"audittrail" if signedaudit=true
"fschange" if signedaudit=false

member.summary: Gets or sets the index name of this Windows Perfmon input.

member.summary: Gets or sets the counter instances of this Windows Perfmon input. An asterisk ("*") is equivalent to all instances.

member.summary: Gets or sets the interval at which to poll the performance counters for this Windows Perfmon input.

member.summary: Gets the input type of this object, Windows Perfmon input.

member.name: P:Splunk.WindowsPerfmonInput.Object
member.summary: Gets or sets the performance monitor object for this Windows Perfmon input (for example, "Process", "Server", or "PhysicalDisk".)

member.name: P:Splunk.WindowsPerfmonInput.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source value to populate in he source field for events from this data input.

remarks.para: The same source should not be used for multiple events.

member.summary: Gets or sets the sourcetype value to populate in the sourcetype field for incoming events.
member.remarks: This property is available in Splunk 5.0 and later.
